title: Love Actually's Olivia Olson is hoping to become a singer after rising to fame as a child star
text:

Love Actually star Olivia Olson is hoping to finally move on from the film and become a full-time singer after her appearance this weekend on The X Factor : Celebrity.

Olivia, 27, is known to millions as the small girl called Joanna Anderson who was just ten when she was on the 2003 classic British romcom and sang All I want for Christmas is You.

Since then she has tried her hand at acting but is still mainly asked about that role despite it being nearly two decades ago.

Olivia told the Mirror: “I’m kind of hoping that if I get through to the live shows I can shed that image a little bit.

(Image: ITV UNIVERSAL)

"It won’t be “Oh, she’s the little girl from Love Actually!”, it’ll be, ‘She’s Olivia. She’s a grown woman who's a music artist’.”

Hinting at some frustration about her career since Love Actually, she added: “Everyone wants to know the little anecdotes and the little quips of what it was like.

"The best way I can describe it is like, ‘do you remember a lot from when you were nine?’

"If someone was like, ‘hey, remember that play you did? Tell me about your experience with that’. For some people I am always going to be Joanna.”

A source on the show said Simon Cowell had spoken to her about finding her own identity.

She has released an album called Nowhere Land in 2018 but is hoping she could have a high profile music career off the back of the ITV show.
